Fur. 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum (Fortuna),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 397</bibl></cit>: rite secundarent visus, <hi rend="ital">that they would prosper well the tokens</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">secure them a favorable issue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 635</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secundum: <entryFree id="n43272" type="main" key="se^cundum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcundum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>sequor</etym>. <sense id="n43272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43272.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">After</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind: Am.</hi> Age, i ut secundum. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Sequor, subsequor te, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43272.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the next place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secondly</hi> (so very rare): animadvertendum primum, quibus de causis constituerint paces; secundum, quā fide eas coluerint, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 15</bibl> (but secundum is a false reading for iterum in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 1</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n43272.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n43272.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n43272.5" n="1" level="3"> In space. </sense><sense id="n43272.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Following after</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ite hac secundum vos me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos secundum ferre haec,</quote> <trans><tr>after us</tr>, <tr>behind us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: secundum ipsam aram aurum abscondidi, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 890</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n43272.7" n="b" level="4"> Following an extension in space, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum leno secundum parietem transversus iret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (legiones) iter secundum mare superum faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex legiones ad oppidum Gergoviam secundum flumen Elaver duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc est hominum secundum litus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus saepes fieri secundum vias publicas solent et secundum amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: secundum flumen, <pb n="1655" /> <cb n="SECU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castra secundum mare haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: vulnus accepit in capite secundum aurem, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centaurium secundum fontes nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43272.8" n="2" level="3"> In time, succession, rank, value, etc., <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next to</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">secundum vindemiam, ubi vites ablaqueantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua ratio est, ut secundum binos ludos mihi respondere incipias: mea, ut ante primos ludos comperendinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctium vernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem,</quote> <trans><tr>after going to sleep</tr>, <tr>while asleep</tr>, <tr>in a dream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 61, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum patrem tu es pater proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proxime et secundum deos homines hominibus maxime utiles esse possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille mihi secundum te et liberos nostros ita est, ut sit paene par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum te nihil est mihi amicius solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui secundum deos nomen Romanum veneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in actione secundum vocem vultus valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum ea quaero, servarisne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">secundum ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. (with preceding maxime) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 3</bibl> Fabri ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n43272.9" n="B" level="2"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n43272.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeably to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tigna prona et fastigata, ut secundum naturam fluminis procumberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum naturam vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius esse secundum naturam, quam contra eam, vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collaudavi secundum facta et virtutes tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duumviros secundum legem facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:9" default="NO">12, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum consuetudinem praedatum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43272.11" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">according to the will of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in favor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the advantage of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiat populo, pontifices secundum se decrevisse...multa secundum causam nostram disputavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de absente secundum praesentem judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum eam (partem) litem judices dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei, quae undique secundum nos sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post principia belli secundum Flavianos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
secundus: <entryFree id="n43273" type="main" key="se^cundus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sequor</etym>, <sense id="n43273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">following.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43273.1" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to sequor, I. B. 2.) </sense><sense id="n43273.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the following</hi> in time or order, <hi rend="ital">the next to the first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the second</hi> (cf.: alter, proximus); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: si te secundo lumine hic offendero, <hi rend="ital">the next morning</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl>: de tribus unum esset optandum...optimum est facere; secundum, nec facere nec pati; <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimum digladiari semper, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the next best</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:14:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 14, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id secundum erat de tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem obligare secundo sacramento, priore amisso, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prioribus equitum partibus secundis additis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma condita est secundo anno Olympiadis septimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympias secunda et sexagesima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriens incendium belli Punici secundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: aliquem secundum heredem instituere, <hi rend="ital">the second</hi> or <hi rend="ital">substituted heir</hi>, if the first-named die or refuse the inheritance, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 61</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3416</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <trans><tr>the second course</tr>, <tr>dessert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:167" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 53, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania,</quote> <trans><tr>Lower Germany</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcundae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. membranae), <hi rend="ital">the after-birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secundines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non magis pertinere quam secundas ad editum infantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 13, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:123" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 43, § 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae partūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 23, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:115" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 11, 44, § 115</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43273.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43273.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second</hi> in rank, value, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ordo proxime accedit, ut secundus sit ad regium principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiā secundus a rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 66" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with which cf.: secundus a Romulo conditor urbis Romanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax, heros ab Achille secundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui honos secundus a rege erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: nil majus generatur ipso (Jove), <cb n="SECU" /> Nec viget quicquam simile aut secundum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (Juppiter) secundo Caesare regnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 51</bibl></cit>; corresp. to <hi rend="ital">maxime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime vellem...secundo autem loco, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me maxime consolatur spes, etc....facile secundo loco me consolatur recordatio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotes Creticae diu maximam laudem habuere, secundam Laconicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 164</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli Campanorum secundus vinctus ad mortem rapior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 10, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">regio spatio locorum nulli earum gentium secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus sibi, non par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda nobilitas Falerno agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:8:section=62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas amomo pallido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:28:section=48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 66" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 66</bibl>; cf. supra.—</sense><sense id="n43273.5" n="b" level="4"> With the prevailing idea of subjection or inferiority, <hi rend="ital">secondary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subordinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior; absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae sortis ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>only of the second grade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneri velle ac posse secunda virtus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:25:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(servi) quasi secundum hominum genus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivit siliquis et pane secundo (i. e. secundario),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 123</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secundarius panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tenue argentum venaeque secundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fuit altera persona Thebis, sed tamen secunda ita, ut proxima esset Epaminondae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ulli veterum virtute secundus,</quote> <trans><tr>inferior</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 441</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vertere cuiquam Frena secundus Halys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:574" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 574</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in phrase partes secundae, <hi rend="ital">second parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in actoribus Graecis, ille qui est secundarum aut tertiarum partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut credas partis mimum tractare secundas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic erit a mensis fine secunda dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the last day but one of the month</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:710" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 710</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcundae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. partes), <hi rend="ital">the second</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inferior parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spinther secundarum tertiarum Pamphilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2644</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Arrius, qui fuit M. Crassi quasi secundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">secundas sortiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43273.6" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to sequor, II.) </sense><sense id="n43273.7" n="1" level="3"> Prop., naut. t. t., of currents of water, etc., <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi> (as following the course of the vessel): <cit><quote lang="la">secundo flumine ad Lutetiam iter facere coepit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>down the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totā rate in secundam aquam labente,</quote> <trans><tr>with the current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ventum et aestum uno tempore nactus secundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 7</bibl></cit>; and, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Neptunus) curru secundo,</quote> <trans><tr>speeding along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo amne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of winds: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum vento secundo, velo passo pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videam navem secundis ventis cursum tenentem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 102</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquilo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 201</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum secundissimo vento cursum teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>.—Of sails (trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">des ingenio vela secunda meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:790" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 790</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43273.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> any thing: austri anniversarii secundo sole flant, i. e. <hi rend="ital">according to the course of the sun</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 31</bibl>: squama secunda (opp. adversa), as we say, <hi rend="ital">with the grain</hi>, i. e. so as to offer no resistance to the hand when it is passed from the head to the tail, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43273.9" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (opp. adversus); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo populo aliquid facere,</quote> <trans><tr>with the consent of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">concio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas concionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admurmurationes cuncti senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: rumor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 17</bibl> (Ann. v. 260 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentibus ac secundis diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dis auspicibus et Junone secundā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo Marte ruat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adi pede sacra secundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 302</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 255: auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. avis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 82 Vahl.); and in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> hypallage: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 739</bibl></cit>: scitus, secunda loquens in tempore, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 251 Vahl.): <cb n="SECU" /> res (opp. adversae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 74</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae (opp. adversae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 23, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and tempora (opp. adversi casus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 24</bibl></cit>; so, res, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=257" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 257</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 357 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl> (with prosperitates); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 502</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 30</bibl>: fortunae, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. parsi, p. 242 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus Galliae,</quote> <trans><tr>successful</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 59</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">belli exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua militia secundiore famā fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundissima proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda (sc. verba) irae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>increasing</tr>, <tr>promoting it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundiore equitum proelio nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres leges secundissimas plebei, adversas nobilitati tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>: omnia secundissima nobis, adversissima illis accidisse videntur, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, B.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcunda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">favorable circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat infestis, metuit secundis Alteram sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, me in tuis secundis respice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium secundorum adversorumque causes in deos vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secundis sapere et consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 42, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius homo inter secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo confidat nimium secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 615" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscunt fidem secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 934" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 934</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda non habent unquam modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 694" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 694</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43274" type="main" key="Se^cundus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕcundus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕcunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. secundus</etym>, <sense id="n43274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43274.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Plinius Secundus, <hi rend="ital">the writer on natural history.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43274.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Plinius Caecilius Secundus, <hi rend="ital">his nephew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OCTAVIA Q. F. SECVNDA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 445, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 60</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
secure: <entryFree id="n43275" type="main" key="se_cu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. securus <sense id="n43275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
securiclatus: <entryFree id="n43276" type="main" key="se^cu_ri^cla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭclātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>securicula, II.</etym>. <sense id="n43276.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Shaped like a hatchet-head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dovetailed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43276.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭclāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">a weed growing among lentils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatchet-vetch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl> (al. securidaca).</sense></entryFree>
securicula: <entryFree id="n43277" type="main" key="se^cu_ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>securis</etym>. <sense id="n43277.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little axe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hatchet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:114 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 114 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>, sericulam).—</sense><sense id="n43277.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in carpentry, <hi rend="ital">a mortise in the shape of a hatchethead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dovetail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17</bibl> (10, 11, 8).</sense></entryFree>
securidaca: <entryFree id="n43278" type="main" key="se^cu_ri^da_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭdāca</orth>, v. securiclatus, II.</entryFree>
securifer: <entryFree id="n43279" type="hapax" key="se^cu_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>securisfero</etym>, <sense id="n43279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">axe-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyracmon,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>armed with a battle-axe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 460</bibl></cit>; cf. securiger.</sense></entryFree>
securiger: <entryFree id="n43280" type="main" key="se^cu_ri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>securisgero</etym>, <sense id="n43280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">axe-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Amazons armed with battle-axes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:48" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nealces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:191" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 470" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 470</bibl></cit>; cf. securifer.</sense></entryFree>
securis: <entryFree id="n43281" type="main" key="se^cu_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūris</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> securim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 224</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 656</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">696</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 201</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 6</bibl>: <sense id="n43281.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">securem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 123</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 3</bibl>, ext. 3; 3, 2, ext. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 758</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> securi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 5, § 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl>; 2, 5, 50, § 133; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 824</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 510</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">secure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 216, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 16</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>seco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an axe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hatchet</hi> with a broad edge (cf. bipennis). </sense><sense id="n43281.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., as a domestic utensil, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rustica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—For felling trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:649" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 649</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl>.—For hewing stones in the quarries, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 87</bibl>. —For fighting, <hi rend="ital">a battle-axe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 656</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 696</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 306</bibl>; 7, 184; 7, 627; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anceps,</quote> <trans><tr>a two-edged axe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 397</bibl></cit> (just before, bipennifer).—For slaying animals for sacrifice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 249</bibl>.—As the <hi rend="ital">cutting edge</hi> of a vine-dresser's bill, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43281.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43281.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an executioner</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s axe</hi>, for beheading criminals<pb n="1656" /> <cb n="SECU" />  (borne by the lictors in the fasces; <cit><quote lang="la">v. fascis): missi lictores ad sumendum supplicium nudatos virgis caedunt securique feriunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>behead them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. 5; so, <cit><quote lang="la">securi ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:38" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictae in principum colla secures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securibus cervices subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 83</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, B.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicola statim secures de fascibus demi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:996" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 996</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1234" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sumit aut ponit secures Arbitrio popularis aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevumque securi Aspice Torquatum (as having caused his own son to be executed),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 824</bibl></cit>.—Comically, in a double sense, acc. to I.: <cit><quote lang="la">te, cum securi, caudicali praeficio provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis Tenedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; v. Tenedos.—</sense><sense id="n43281.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43281.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death-blow</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">graviorem rei publicae infligere securim,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a death-blow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 29, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam te securim putas injecisse petitioni tuae, cum? etc. (just before: plaga est injecta petitioni tuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43281.6" n="2" level="3"> With reference to the axe in the fasces, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43281.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Usu. in <number>plur.</number>: Gallia securibus subjecta, perpetuā premitur servitute, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to Roman supremacy</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vacui a securibus et tributis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis inperium hic primus saevasque secures Accipiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 819</bibl></cit>: Medus Albanas timet secures, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Roman authority</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendam multa securibus recidenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43281.8" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Germania colla Romanae praebens animosa securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
securitas: <entryFree id="n43282" type="main" key="se_cu_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcūrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>securus</etym>, <sense id="n43282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freedom from care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43282.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (class.): Democriti securitas, quae est animi tamquam tranquillitas, quam appellavit <foreign lang="greek">eu)qumi/an,</foreign> eo separanda fuit ab hac disputatione, quia ista animi tranquillitas ea ipsa est beata vita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitatem nunc appello vacuitatem aegritudinis, in quā vita beata posita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacandum omni est animi perturbatione, ut tranquillitas animi et securitas assit, quae affert cum constantiam tum etiam dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatam vitam in animi securitate et in omnium vacatione munerum ponimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 45</bibl> and 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 52</bibl> (opp. cura); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 12</bibl> (opp. timor); 7, 6, 14; 7, 10, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitas inaffectatae orationis,</quote> <trans><tr>quietness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis ac vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (opp. curae): <cit><quote lang="la">somno ac securitatibus jam dudum hoc fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operosissima securitas mortis in M. Ofilio Hilaro ab antiquis traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43282.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi> (not till after the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. incuria): neminem celerius opprimi quam qui nihil timeret et frequentissimum initium esse calamitatis securitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res altera taedium laboris, altera securitatem parit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:13" default="NO">2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:4" default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; 4, 1, 55; 6, 1, 34; 6, 3, 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO">4, 20, 8</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae plerumque inhaeret fidelius, quod nullā scribendi securitate laxatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43282.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., <hi rend="ital">freedom from danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi> (not till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">cum innumerabilia sint mortis signa, salutis securitatisque nulla sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitatis urbanae custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:98:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 98, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitas securitate mutuā persciscenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">securitati ante quam vindictae consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetua Romani imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 103, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela securitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:128:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 128, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec spem modo ac votum securitas publica, sed ipsius voti fiduciam assumserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum a repentinā securitate datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras securitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a safe conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, SECVRITAS, personified as <hi rend="ital">the tutelary goddess of the Roman State</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1830</bibl> and 1831.—</sense><sense id="n43282.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a guarantee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi> for a debt or obligation (by hypothecation, mortgage; by receipt or acknowledgment, etc.): <cb n="SECU" /> id quod sibi debetur, consequi debet vel ejus securitatem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 4, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:43" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
securus: <entryFree id="n43283" type="main" key="se_cu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>se = sine and cura</etym>, i. q. non or nibil curans, <sense id="n43283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">free from care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcerned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untroubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43283.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43283.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (class.; cf. tutus); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, meis ab tergo tutis, securus bellum Nabidi inferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securus solutusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with otiosus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securus Hermippus Temnum proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine militis usu Mollia securae peragebant otia gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secura quidem, fausto tamen omine laeta Mater abit templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:784" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 784</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a non securo Eumene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres natā secura receptā,</quote> <trans><tr>easy now that she had found</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 572</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 77</bibl> (v. infra, b.): <cit><quote lang="la">de linguā Latinā securi es animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de facilitate credentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: securos vos ab hac parte reddemus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 24</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">securior ab Samnitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani securi pro salute de gloriā certabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pro vobis sollicitior, aut pro me securior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ne sis secura futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 137</bibl></cit>; so, suis (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of sus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:435" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremi sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:781" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi atque mei,</quote> <trans><tr>unconcerned about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorum germanae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 350</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 326: poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam parvae observationis (Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec securam incrementi sui patiebatur esse Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (motus) Campaniam numquam securam hujus mali...vastavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (rogum) uxoria pietas mortis secura conscendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>, ext. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">his persuadet, ut securo fugae suae Eumeni superveniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discurrunt securi casus ejus, qui supervenit ignaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 8</bibl></cit> (v. infra, b.). —With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestit nummum in loculos demittere, post hoc Securus, cadat an recto stet fabula talo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 50</bibl> (opp. laboret); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 26, 6</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis etiam errore labatur vestrum quoque, non sum securus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. things. </sense><sense id="n43283.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Free from care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untroubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">deos securum agere aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies (leti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:939" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 939</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus (Herculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia nato recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:455" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>careless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of the careless idler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox securae claritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus securius,</quote> <trans><tr>more free from care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">securior materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">securos ab eo metu somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 149</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota secura repulsae,</quote> <trans><tr>safe against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that frees from care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 715</bibl></cit> (securos ab effectu, Serv. ad l. l.).—</sense><sense id="n43283.6" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:3" default="NO">11, 3, 3</bibl>.—Of abstract things: castrensis jurisdictio, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off-hand</hi> (shortly after, opp. gravis, intentus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., of a thing or place, <hi rend="ital">free from danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> (not till after the Aug. period, and rare for the class. tutus): <cit><quote lang="la">hostis levis et velox et repentinus, qui nullum usquam tempus, nullum locum quietum aut securum esse sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tripolim securissimam reddidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (hominum) ea natura est, ut secura velint,</quote> <trans><tr>safety</tr>, <tr>security</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitā inundatione Tiberis non modo jacentia et plana urbis loca sed secura ejusmodi casuum implevit,</quote> <trans><tr>secure from such accidents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, </sense><sense id="n43283.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cūrē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n43283.9" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcernedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lente ac secure aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 3</bibl> (with neglegenter);<cb n="SECU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> al.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Safely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">securely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43283.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcūrĭter</orth> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joan. Ep. ad Parth. Tr. 10:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joan. Ep. ad Parth. Tr. 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secus: <entryFree id="n43284" type="main" key="se^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcus</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, v. sexus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43285" type="main" key="se^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcus</orth>. <sense id="n43285.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> <etym>root seq- or secof sequor, q. v.</etym>, only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquĭor</orth>, <itype>us, ōris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worse</hi> (only post-class.; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in sequiorem sexum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexus sequioris fetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 249, 33; <cit><quote lang="la">8, p. 206, 7: vitae sequioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna sequior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (prop., <hi rend="ital">following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi> in rank or order, i. e. <hi rend="ital">less</hi> than something mentioned before; hence, in gen.), <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not so;</hi> and esp. freq. with a negative (per litoten), <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">even so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi> (opp. always to what is right, correct, or proper, not to what is wrong; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1056 sq.; for <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> forms, v. I. B. infra). </sense><sense id="n43285.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. aliter): si illuc, quod volumus, eveniet, gaudebimus: Sin secus, patiemur animis aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bonus est, obnoxius sum: sin secus est, faciam, uti jubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum genera esse dicuntur tamquam poëtarum. Id secus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ille est) quem dudum dixi. Hoc si secus reperies, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videsne, quod paulo ante secus tibi videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: magnum mehercule hominem, nemo dicet secus; <cit><quote lang="la">sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si ita esset... ad amicitiam esset aptissimus: quod longe secus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia longe secus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtote, quanto secus ego fecerim, Cato ap. Charis, p. 192 P.: nobis aliter videtur: recte secusne, postea,</quote> <trans><tr>whether rightly or not</tr>, <tr>right or wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte an secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honestis an secus amicis uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bene aut secus consulto,</quote> <trans><tr>for good or ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prout bene ac (al. aut) secus cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout opportune proprieque aut secus collocata sunt (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(artes) utiles aut secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43285.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: secus aetatem agerem, quam illi egissent, Cato ap. Charis, p. 195 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid fiat secus quam volumus quamque oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem sunt membra in utriusque disputatione,
