selago: <entryFree id="n43379" type="main" key="sela_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">selāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling the savin-tree</hi>: Lycopodium selago, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 62, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selas: <entryFree id="n43380" type="greek" key="se^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlas</orth>, <number>plur.</number> <itype>sela</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">se/las</foreign>, <sense id="n43380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fiery meteor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 64, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selectio: <entryFree id="n43381" type="main" key="se_lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>seligo</etym>, <sense id="n43381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choosing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selection</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtutis hoc proprium sit, earum rerum, quae secundum naturam sint, habere delectum: qui omnia sic exaequaverunt, ut in utramque partem ita paria redderent, uti nullā selectione uterentur, virtutem ipsam sustulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem rerum selectione exspoliare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 6, 20: vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
selector: <entryFree id="n43382" type="hapax" key="se_lector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēlector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chooser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selecter</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 3.</sense></entryFree>
selectus: <entryFree id="n43383" type="main" key="se_lectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of seligo.</entryFree>
selene: <entryFree id="n43384" type="main" key="Se^le_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕlēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*selh/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n43384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Ptolemy Physco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Antiochus and Seleucus of Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 61</bibl> Zumpt; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selenion: <entryFree id="n43385" type="greek" key="se^le_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlēnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">selh/nion,</foreign> <sense id="n43385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the peony</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also selenogonon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
selenitis: <entryFree id="n43386" type="greek" key="se^le_ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlēnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlēnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">selhni=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n43386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crystalline gypsum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selenite.</hi> Form selenitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form selenites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37, 31</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selenitium: <entryFree id="n43387" type="greek" key="se^le_ni_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlēnītĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ivy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 146</bibl> (al. Silenicis).</sense></entryFree>
selenogonon: <entryFree id="n43388" type="main" key="se^le_no^go^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlēnŏgŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. selenion.</entryFree>
seleucia: <entryFree id="n43389" type="main" key="Se^leuci^_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕleucĭ_a</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕleucĕ_a</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*seleu/keia,</foreign> <sense id="n43389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities in Asia.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43389.1" n="I" level="1"> Pieria, <hi rend="ital">a city in Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Orontes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kepse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43389.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated city in Babylonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the river Tigris</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">ElModain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Ep. Mithrid. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Ep. Mithrid. 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Seleucia Parthorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>; form Seleucea, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43389.3" n="III" level="1"> Seleucia Trachēa = <foreign lang="greek">*seleu/keia h( traxei = a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a city of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seleucis: <entryFree id="n43390" type="main" key="Se^leucis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕleucis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bird on Mount Casius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 27, 39, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seleucus: <entryFree id="n43391" type="main" key="Se^leucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕleucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*se/leukos.</foreign> <sense id="n43391.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several kings of Syria;</hi> their ancestor, Seleucus Nicator, a general of Alexander the Great after the latter's death founded the kingdom of the Seleucidae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:1" default="NO">15, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43391.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a servant of</hi> Q. Lepta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43391.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a player on the cithern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selgiticus: <entryFree id="n43392" type="main" key="Selgi^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Selgĭtĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Selgĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Selga</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Pisidia</hi>: (oleum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 49, § 95</bibl></sense></entryFree>
selibra: <entryFree id="n43393" type="main" key="se_libra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-libra</orth> (e short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:57" default="NO">10, 57</bibl> 1), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>semi</etym>, <sense id="n43393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-pound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16</bibl>. 19, § 108; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
seligo: <entryFree id="n43394" type="main" key="se_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-lĭgo</orth>, lēgi. <itype>lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>se-lego</etym>. <sense id="n43394.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. <hi rend="ital">separate by culling out; to choose out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cul select</hi> (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: eligo, deligo), nec vero utetur imprudenter hac copia (communium locorum), sed omnia expendet et seliget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 22</bibl> Orell. and Otto <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: ex quo (commentario) tu, quae digna sunt, selige, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">selectae sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) selecta pectora Patres dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43394.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43394.2" n="A" level="2"> Judices selecti, <hi rend="ital">the judges in criminal suits selected by the prœtor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:43:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 43, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:132" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 10, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest ad haec sumi judex ex turbā selectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 7, § 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43394.3" n="B" level="2"> Di selecti, acc. to Varro, <hi rend="ital">the following twenty Roman deities</hi> (twelve <cb n="SELL" /> male and eight female): Deos selectos esse Janum, Jovem, Saturnum, Genium, Mercurium, Apollinem, Martem, Vulcanum, Neptunum, Solem, Orcum, Liberum patrem, Tellurem, Cererem, Junonem, Lunam, Dianam, Minervam, Venerem, Vestam, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 2 sq.; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 33. The sixteenth book of Varro's Antiquitates rerum divinarum treats of the di selecti; cf. Becker, Antiq. 4, p. 24 sq.</sense></entryFree>
selinas: <entryFree id="n43395" type="greek" key="se^li_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlīnas</orth> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. -ada), <itype>ādis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cabbage resembling parsley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selinon: <entryFree id="n43396" type="greek" key="se^li_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕlīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">se/linon,</foreign> pure Lat. apium, <sense id="n43396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parsley</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
selinus: <entryFree id="n43397" type="main" key="Se^li_nu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕlīnūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*selinou=s.</foreign> <sense id="n43397.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Lilybœum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pileri</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 705</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:201" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 201</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43397.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕlīnūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Selinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Selinusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:194" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 16, 56, § 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43397.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕlīnuntĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Selinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43397.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the coast of Cilicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Selinty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 5</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a river near it of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seliquastrum: <entryFree id="n43398" type="main" key="se_li^quastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēlĭquastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab sedendo appellatae sedes, sedile, solium, sellae, seliquastrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=128" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 128</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seliquastra sedilia antiqui generis appellantur D littera in L conversa, ut etiam in sellā factum est et subsellio et solio, quae non minus a sedendo dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340</bibl></cit> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:9" default="NO">3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sella: <entryFree id="n43399" type="main" key="sella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sella</orth> (ancient collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sedda</orth>, acc. to Scaur. p. 2252 P.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>for sedla; root sed-; .sedes</etym>, <sense id="n43399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stool</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedile, scamnum): viden' ut expalluit! datin' isti sellam, ubi assidat cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabilla, sellas, solia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">157, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sellā sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit> (corresp. to sedes): <cit><quote lang="la">fracta est patris sella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altā deducere sellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:136 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 136 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43399.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n43399.2" n="A" level="2"> Of a mechanic's <hi rend="ital">work-stool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum sellae atque operis et quaestus cottidiani locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro sellam ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43399.3" n="B" level="2"> Of a teacher's <hi rend="ital">chair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43399.4" n="C" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">a portable chair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sedan</hi> (different from the lectica, a litter made like a bed): <cit><quote lang="la">aut sellā, aut lecticā transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>; so (opp. lectica) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:10:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:12" default="NO">11, 98, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">simply sella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:124 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 124 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sella gestatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gestamen sellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43399.5" n="D" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">a seat in a coach or wagon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43399.6" n="E" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">a close-stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 193" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:227" default="NO">227</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called sella familiarica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43399.7" n="F" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">a saddle</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43399.8" n="G" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a magistrate's seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chair</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 47, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 97</bibl> et saep.; also called sella curulis; v. curulis.—Prov.: duabus sellis sedere, <hi rend="ital">to sit on two stools</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to keep in with both parties</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sellaria: <entryFree id="n43400" type="main" key="sella_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sella</etym>, <sense id="n43400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a room furnished with seats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settles; a sitting-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawing-room</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:111" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 111</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used by Tiberius for debauchery,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>; cf. sellarius.—</sense><sense id="n43400.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A public courtesan</hi>, Vet. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sellariolus: <entryFree id="n43401" type="hapax" key="sella_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sellaria</etym>, <sense id="n43401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for sitting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">popinae, as a resort for idlers and debauchees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:70:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 70, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sellaris: <entryFree id="n43402" type="main" key="sella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sella</etym>, <sense id="n43402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a seat</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gestatio,</quote> <trans><tr>in a sedan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:92" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>furnished with saddles</tr>, <tr>used for riding</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sellāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a saddlehorse</hi>, Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Arel. 2, 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sellarius: <entryFree id="n43403" type="main" key="sella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sellaria</etym>, <sense id="n43403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that practises lewdness upon a settle</hi> (a word invented by the emperor Tiberius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; v. sellaria.</sense></entryFree>
sellasia: <entryFree id="n43404" type="main" key="Sellasi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sellasĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sellasi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n43404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Œnus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">St. Saranda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sellisternia: <entryFree id="n43405" type="main" key="selli^sterni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellĭsternĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sella-sterno; cf. lectisternium</etym>, <sense id="n43405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">religious banquets offered</hi> <cb n="SEME" /> <hi rend="ital">to female deities</hi> (because, at table, the women sat upon sellae, while the men reclined upon lecti, whence lectisternium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl>; Fest. s. v. solla, pp. 298 and 299 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 176</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno et Minerva in sellas ad cenam invitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: sellisternium = <foreign lang="greek">sella/strwsis,</foreign> Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
sellula: <entryFree id="n43406" type="main" key="sellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sella</etym>, <sense id="n43406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stool;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a sedan</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. sellularius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:44" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sellularius: <entryFree id="n43407" type="main" key="sellu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sellŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sellula</etym>, <sense id="n43407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a chair</hi>: quaestus, <hi rend="ital">sedentary occupations</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <trans><tr>a mechanic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 351, 21.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sel-lŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mechanic</hi>: de plebeiā faece sellulariorum, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Pelag. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Pelag. 2, 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opificum vulgus et sellularii, minime militiae idoneum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
selymbria: <entryFree id="n43408" type="main" key="Se_lymbri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēlymbrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*shlumbri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n43408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Propontis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semanimis: <entryFree id="n43409" type="main" key="se_ma^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. semianimis.</entryFree>
semanticus: <entryFree id="n43410" type="greek" key="se_manti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">shmantiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n43410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">designating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having an indicative force</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 985, 988.</sense></entryFree>
sembella: <entryFree id="n43411" type="main" key="sembella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sembella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from semi and libella</etym>, <sense id="n43411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half</hi>-libella (a coin): <cit><quote lang="la">sembella quod libellae dimidium, quod semis assis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=174" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 174</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem rationem habere assem ad semissem, quam habet in argento libella ad sembellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, § 38 ib.</sense></entryFree>
semel: <entryFree id="n43412" type="main" key="se^me^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕmĕl</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>root sam-, one; Sanscr. sa-, sam-, with, together; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma, a(/pac;</foreign> cf.: sem-per, sim-ilis, sim-plex, sin-gulus, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n43412.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a single time</hi>: ter sub armis malim vitam cernere, Quam semel modo parere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 261, 9</bibl> (Trag. v. 298 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">potin' ut semel modo huc respicias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis sum semel deceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel fugiendi si data est occasio, Satis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">semel si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit> (but cf.: si semel, infra, II. B. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui vel semel ita est usus oculis, ut vera cerneret, is, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:52:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 52, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut attendant, semel bisne signum canat in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel in mense sulcos sarrito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Crassum) semel ait in vitā risisse Lucilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">semel in vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel adhuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 35, § 100</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Valerius Corvinus sellā curuli semel ac vicies sedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 157</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: vicies et semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108, 102, § 243</bibl></cit>: sol omni terrarum ambitu non semel major, <hi rend="ital">not greater by once</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not as large again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not twice as large</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud semel sed centies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semel, sed bis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:77:section=179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 77, § 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semel, sed saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semel sed saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 43:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 43, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:102:7" default="NO">102, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plus quam semel eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 4</bibl>; also without <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: plus semel, <hi rend="ital">more than once</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 17, § 96</bibl>: Janum Quirinum semel atque iterum clausum, <hi rend="ital">once and again</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">twice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus bis clausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:64" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 64</bibl>; cf. also Plut. Num. 20); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; but also in a more gen. sense: pecuniam semel atque iterum dare coacti sunt, <hi rend="ital">time and again</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 26</bibl> (8, 16): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc semel ille iterumque neglexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his Aeduos semel atque iterum armis contendisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B.G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so too <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 46</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: semel iterumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">115, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso saepe dicebat, minus saepe Pomponius, raro Carbo, semel aut iterum Philippus,</quote> <trans><tr>only once or twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:308" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel et saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 33</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an quod semel jus est, idem et saepius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—Late Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">semel et bis,</quote> <trans><tr>repeatedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; Greg. M. Ep. 5, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43412.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43412.2" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/pac,</foreign> of that which occurs <hi rend="ital">no more than</hi> <pb n="1664" /> <cb n="SEME" /> <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but a single time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once for all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum facile orari, Caesar, tum semel exorari soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus semel ignotum a te esse oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis est datus, cum quo dimicantes aut vitam semel aut ignominiam finirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totas semel absorbere placentas,</quote> <trans><tr>to swallow entire cakes at once</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procubuit moriens et humum semel ore momordit,</quote> <trans><tr>once for all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 418</bibl></cit>; cf.: nulla reparabilis arte Laesa pudicitia est; <cit><quote lang="la">deperit illa semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel aeternā nocte premenda fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis vero homicidio semel interdicto,</quote> <trans><tr>once for all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic et semel Christus oblatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 3, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam se semel a caeli contemplatione averterunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence in Florus: semel in perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel et in perpetuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of speech, <hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once for all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum postulasset, ut sibi fundus, cujus emptor erat, semel indicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 62</bibl></cit> (for which, just before: <cit><quote lang="la">non plus quam semel): interim, quod pluribus collegit adversarius, satis est semel proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel, plura complectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO">1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:34" default="NO">2, 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quod sentio, semel finiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquam denique, ut semel finiam, in lite cantat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; so (after denique) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43412.3" n="B" level="2"> In a succession = primum, primo, <hi rend="ital">the first time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstravimus, L. Vibullium Rufum bis in potestatem pervenisse Caesaris, semel ad Corfinium, iterum in Hispaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; so after bis, with <hi rend="ital">iterum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; id. t<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6</bibl> Oud.; 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; after ter, with <hi rend="ital">iterum</hi> and <hi rend="ital">tertio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 11</bibl>.—Without <hi rend="ital">iterum</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad idem, unde semel profecta sunt, cuncta astra redierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti exorta est semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43412.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., like primum, to denote the simple antecedence of an occurrence; hence, most freq. with the particles ut, ubi, quando, cum, si, etc., <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at some time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at any time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod semel dixi, haud mutabo,</quote> <trans><tr>what I have once said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Complacitum est semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis sum semel deceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verebamini, ne non id facerem quod recepissem semel?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec accidere, ut quisquam te timere incipiat eorum, qui semel a te sint liberati timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id, quod semel invasit, incumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retrahi nequitum, quoquo progressa est semel, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. nequitum, p. 162 Müll.—So too in the comically formed proper name: Quodsemelarripides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—With particles; with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hasce aedes pedem Nemo intro tetulit, semel ut emigravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut occepi semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel eloquentia evecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel gloriam consecutus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique ut semel finiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi erit accubitum semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi animus semel cupiditate se devinxit malā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quandoquidem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge, quandoquidem occepisti semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quando</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando in apertum semel discrimen evasura esset res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae proclivius ad perniciem, cum semel coepit, labitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Antonius) quoniam semel induxit animum, sibi licere quod vellet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ov H. 12, 11: illam partem, quoniam semel ita vobis placuit, non recusabo quominus perpoliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 28, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 7</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si semel amoris peculum accepit, Extemplo et ipsus periit et res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istam semel amiseris libertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 106</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illum semel prehendero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si semel animum tuom perspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et semel emissum volat inrevocabile verbam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 71</bibl></cit> (but, semel si, <hi rend="ital">if once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>, as an emphatic numeral, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).—With participles (several times in Liv. and Quint.): ut adversando remorandoque incitato semel militi adderent impetum,<cb n="SEME" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 7</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:9" default="NO">7, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24 al" default="NO">10, 7, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
semele: <entryFree id="n43413" type="main" key="Se^me^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, pure Lat. collat. form in the cass. obll.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*seme/lh,</foreign> <sense id="n43413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Bacchus by Jupiter; nom.</hi> Semele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 485</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 167" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 167</bibl> and 179; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Semelae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semeles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 274</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 278</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> Semelae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl> (3, 24), 27; <case>acc.</case> Semelen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:715" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semelam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> Semelā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl> (3, 28), 29: <cit><quote lang="la">Semele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 179" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 179</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43413.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmĕlēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Semele</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 329</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 640</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyoneus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43413.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmĕlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Semele</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:903" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 903</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semen: <entryFree id="n43414" type="main" key="se_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root sa-, sē-; cf.: sero, sevi; Saturnus, sator, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n43414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Seed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43414.1" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen manu spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra semen excepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 623</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43414.2" n="2" level="3"> Of men, animals, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:4" default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:7:10 al" default="NO">3, 7, 10 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1031</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1034" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1034</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 748</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 760</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43414.3" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">elements</hi> of other bodies (of fire, water, stones, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignis semina convolvunt e nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:201 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 201 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:444" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:507" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 507</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 841: quaerit pars semina flammae in venis silicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 144</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis quasi virtutum igniculi et semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43414.4" n="B" level="2"> <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">spelt-seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spelt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:198" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 24, 55, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43414.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43414.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A shoot</hi> used for propagating; <hi rend="ital">a graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO">3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:1" default="NO">5, 10, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43414.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">genus ac semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>; so (with genus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa regio semine orta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum, ut boni seminis pecus habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43414.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit in cineres labi sua Phoebus eosdem Semina, sed natum flammis Eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 629</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:470" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 470</bibl></cit>; 15, 216; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:383" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 987" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 987</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43414.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as in all languages, <hi rend="ital">seed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause;</hi> of persons, <hi rend="ital">an author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insligator</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n43414.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (the predom. signif. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">stirps ac semen malorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum civilium semen et causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>, cf. ut in seminibus est causa arborum et stirpium: <cit><quote lang="la">sic hujus belli semen ut fuisti (for which, just before: causam belli in personā tuā constitisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43414.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis, quasi virtutum igniculi atque semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et Zeno in suis commentariis quasi semina quaedam sparsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virtutes sunt, ad quas nobis initia quaedam ac semina sunt concessa naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquaces, seditiosos, semina discordiarum (tribunos plebis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix tamen illa semina erant futurae luxuriae,</quote> <trans><tr>the small beginnings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 19, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41</bibl></cit>. futuri exitii, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus facultatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam semina ejus (translationis) quaedam apud Aristotelen reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam probationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sementatio: <entryFree id="n43415" type="hapax" key="se_menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>semento</etym>, <sense id="n43415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seed sown</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sementifer: <entryFree id="n43416" type="hapax" key="se_menti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmentĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sementis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n43416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seed-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seriphus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 476</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sementis: <entryFree id="n43417" type="main" key="se_mentis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmentis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> sementim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl> B. and K.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 30</bibl>; 17, 61 <sense id="n43417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:81" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 81</bibl>, with the var. lect. sementem, a form which appears also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 281</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:90" default="NO">11, 2, 90</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> semente, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:667" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 667</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:8" default="NO">2, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:1" default="NO">2, 11, 1</bibl>; 11, 2, 82; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sementium,<cb n="SEMI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 33</bibl> dub.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>semen</etym>. </sense><sense id="n43417.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sowing</hi> (freq. aud class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. satio): nemo tam sine mente vivit, ut, quid sit sementis ac messis, quid arborum putatio ac vitium, omnino nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>; so (opp. messis) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementim facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:81" default="NO">11, 2, 81</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementis tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementes quam maximas facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 59, § 223</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: ut sementem feceris, ita metes,</quote> <trans><tr>as you sow</tr>, <tr>so will you reap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43417.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dis inmortalibus malorum sementem esse factam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce ego jam sementem in ore faciam pugnosque obseram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will plant blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43417.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43417.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Seed-time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro sicco per sementim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediā sementi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prima, novissima, ultima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43417.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Seed-corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seed sown</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi venit imber, multorum dierum sementis uno die surgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua perfuderit sementem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 4, 26</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">seed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">semen</hi> of animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 163</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43417.6" n="C" level="2"> Sementes, <hi rend="ital">the growing crops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the young crops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young corn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos date perpetuos teneris sementibus auctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:679" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestiviores sementes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sementivus: <entryFree id="n43418" type="main" key="se_menti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sementis</etym>, <sense id="n43418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to seed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriae,</quote> <trans><tr>that occur at seed-time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 6, § 26</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=337" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 337</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sementiva dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:658" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira, perh.,</quote> <trans><tr>that are not ripe till late in autumn</tr>, <tr>late pears</tr>, <tr>frost-pears</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl>: pirum sementivum serum, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: genera frumenti, <hi rend="ital">that are sown in autumn</hi> (opp. verna): <cit><quote lang="la">sementiva autem (appellant) triticum, hordeum, fabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenum,</quote> <trans><tr>proper for sowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semento: <entryFree id="n43419" type="hapax" key="se_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run to seed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae sementaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semermis: <entryFree id="n43420" type="main" key="se_mermis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmermis</orth>, v. semiermis.</entryFree>
semestris: <entryFree id="n43421" type="main" key="se_mestris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sex-mensis</etym>. <sense id="n43421.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of six months</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-yearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-annual</hi>: dies, nox, <hi rend="ital">lasting six months</hi> (far in the north), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus (militaris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; hence also, aurum, <hi rend="ital">the ring of the tribunes</hi> (worn for six months): <cit><quote lang="la">semestri vatum digitos circumligat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <trans><tr>six months old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 39, 60, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, hirundines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 25, 36, § 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43421.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-mestrĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the semi-annual collection of imperial ordinances</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO">18, 7, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 29, 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43422" type="main" key="se_mestris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semi-mensis</etym>, <sense id="n43422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">semi-monthly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the full moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species (lunae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. semestrium.</sense></entryFree>
semestrium: <entryFree id="n43423" type="hapax" key="se_mestri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmestrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half month</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fortnight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semesus: <entryFree id="n43424" type="main" key="se_me_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmēsus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmiēsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 244</bibl>; and 8, 297; cf. Wagn. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 578</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semi-edo</etym>, <sense id="n43424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-eaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-devoured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-consumed</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lardi frusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora liberorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
